coded_answer.p: Dear managerManager of the Circle Theatre
Last SandaySunday my friends and I saw that advertisement about the theatreplay you were supposed to presentput on. We thought that it was a good chance for us to watch it.

"Over the rainbowRainbow" was supposed to start at seven thirty. We went there on time. We waited therthere for forty fiveforty-five minutes for it to start! We couldn't believe it. We really got bored, aslike all the other peaplepeople there.
We were very disappointed because before this happened we pouded the tickets but there were no discounts available. And then delate forty fiveforty-five minuitesminutes to present the show.
Then we expected to, see Danny Brook and Tina Truelove. We did see Tina Truelove but we did not see Danny Brook. That was very disapponteddisappointeddisappointing.

Fortunately the show finished. We decided to visit the theatre restaurant. But it was closed!! That was a badbadly organized evening, we thought. When we asked why was itit was closed, the people there told us that they did not organizedorganise it before.

I must admit that, that evening wasn't the perfect one out for me but I and for my friends either. It was the worst evening that we all ever hadhad ever had. My friends and I demand our money bacckback realvery soon. And please do not be very suprisedsurprised Ifif you recievereceive more letters about this.
Unfortunately;, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. I didmade a big mistake by trusting him. What a fool was II was.

Last Wednesday my sister told me that our grandmother had a serious illness and she was going to die. She told me to tell noneno one. We didn't want outour grand-mothergrandmother to find it out at that moment so we waswere trying to keep it secret.

I knew Pat, my cousin, loved our grandmother very much. She and Pat had a special relationship. Despite the fact that I had to tellsay nothing, I thought it was right to tell Pat the truth. After a lot of thought I told it to him.
Pat started screaming and shouting. I knew he couldn't stand it. But I was sure he would tellsay nothing. I was wrong. He told me that he had to tell it to my grandmother. I couldn't do anything.
Just asWhen Pat left my house he went right away to the hospital. He found her there. And the worst happened.
My grandmother was very sensitive and bored with life and when she heartheard it, her condition became more serious.
After two days she died. Pat, my sister and I felt very rensposibleresponsible. But there was nothing we could do. We knew we had lost her for ever.
